description.value:
As a corsair, your effectiveness hinges upon taking bold risks to gain the upper hand. These feats of daring-do are represented by your Panache Dice, which are d6. You start with one Panache Die, and can hold up to a maximum of 1 + your Proficiency Bonus Panache Dice at a time. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused Panache Dice and then gain one.

Gaining more Panache Dice to use requires taking risks. You can gain them in the following ways:

  • Whenever you activate your Sneak Attack ability, you can choose to forgo up to half of your sneak attack dice in order to gain a Panache Die for each Sneak Attack die you sacrifice.
  • Before rolling a skill check you are proficient in for a non-trivial task, you can choose to take a penalty equal to your proficiency bonus in order to gain a Panache Die. This penalty is static and not increased by multipliers to your proficiency bonus, such as the Multi-Talented ability.

You can use your Panache dice to fuel special abilities, called Corsair Gambits. You know one Gambit called Scallywag, detailed below, and can add new ones to your roster by taking the Corsair ability associated with each of them.

Growth: Your Panache Die increases in size at each growth level, becoming a d8 at 5th level, d10 at 11th level, and d12 at 17th level.

You learn the following Gambit: @Compendium[undertaking-homebrew.abilities.Y26KXC52QC1Z8Z4L]{Gambit: Scallywag}
